study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary counseling improves micronutrient and macronutrient intakes in gastric banding (GB) surgery patients.
results_summary: Dietary counseling led to significant reductions in energy, protein, cholesterol, and potassium intake, and an increase in vitamin K intake and percent energy from protein. However, most nutrient intake requirements remained unmet by many subjects.
population_specificity: Gastric banding (GB) surgery patients (n=23 initially, n=21 post-intervention).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether maternal serum fatty acid compositions during pregnancy could be improved through dietary counseling advocating increased intake of unsaturated fats and reduced saturated fats.
results_summary: Dietary counseling led to lower saturated fat intake and higher unsaturated fat intake, reflected in improved serum phospholipid PUFA, docosahexaenoic acid, and n-3 FA levels during pregnancy, though effects were not sustained postpartum. Similar changes were observed in cholesteryl esters and triacylglycerols.
population_specificity: Ninety women in their first trimester of pregnancy.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary counseling and provision of appropriate food products, including spreads).
study_duration: From early pregnancy to the third trimester (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of Emotionally Focused Therapy (EFT), Dietary Counseling (DC), and Combined Treatment (CT) on psychopathology and quality of life in patients with Binge Eating Disorder (BED) and obesity.
results_summary: Dietary Counseling alone showed a higher dropout rate and no significant improvement in binge eating scores or body uneasiness compared to EFT and CT. At follow-up, no DC participants achieved the target BES score, though body weight decreased in all groups.
population_specificity: 189 obese adult patients with Binge Eating Disorder (BED).
study_duration: Not specified (assessed at baseline, end-of-treatment, and six-month follow-up)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term effects of dietary counseling initiated in infancy on insulin sensitivity in adolescents aged 15-20 years, and to examine associations between dietary factors (fiber intake and fatty acid ratios) and insulin resistance.
results_summary: The study found that dietary counseling led to a 7.5% lower HOMA-IR (improved insulin sensitivity) in the intervention group compared to controls, with higher dietary fiber intake and a better fatty acid ratio in the intervention group. Dietary fiber intake was associated with lower HOMA-IR in girls, but no association was found for the fatty acid ratio.
population_specificity: Healthy adolescents aged 15-20 years participating in the STRIP study.
study_duration: Counseling was maintained from infancy until 20 years of age.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and effects of low-intensity dietary counseling provided by primary care physicians on lipid levels and diet quality in patients at risk for cardiovascular diseases.
results_summary: The study found that low-intensity dietary counseling led to clinically meaningful improvements in LDL-cholesterol, total cholesterol, and diet quality, with effects comparable to high-intensity interventions. Group A showed significant improvements at month 3, while Group B demonstrated the largest diet improvement at month 6 after receiving the intervention.
population_specificity: Adults aged 21-75 years with LDL-cholesterol ≥3.37 mmol/L, internet access, and active email accounts.
effective_dosage: Counseling provided during routine office visits three months apart, supplemented with printed materials, a minimally interactive website, and weekly reminder emails.
study_duration: 6 months (3-month randomized-controlled phase followed by 3-month intervention in both groups).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the principles and effectiveness of dietary counseling for long-term weight reduction and healthy eating behavior changes.
results_summary: The study found that dietary counseling should be flexible, patient-centered, and focused on gradual changes in eating patterns. It emphasized the importance of motivation and multidisciplinary treatment for successful weight management.
population_specificity: Obese patients seeking weight management.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a combined intervention of dietary education (Mediterranean diet principles) and stress management techniques could effectively reduce blood pressure in hypertensive individuals.
results_summary: The study found that after eight weeks, the intervention group showed significant reductions in office blood pressure (both systolic and diastolic) and perceived stress, along with increased adherence to Mediterranean diet principles, while the control group did not exhibit these improvements.
population_specificity: Hypertensive individuals (intervention group: 16 participants, age 62 ± 12 years, 47% male; control group: 20 participants, age 67 ± 12 years, 31.8% male).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the current evidence on the role of dietary counseling and nutrition support in head and neck cancer patients undergoing curative treatment.
results_summary: The study found that dietary counseling is appropriate for all head and neck cancer patients to maintain adequate oral intake, though some require additional nutrition support. Prognostic indicators like tumor location and stage help identify patients needing early nutrition support, but the overall evidence remains sparse and of poor quality.
population_specificity: Head and neck cancer patients undergoing curative treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between the DASH diet and oxidative stress in women diagnosed with migraine, as well as its effects on migraine clinical indices.
results_summary: The DASH diet significantly reduced nitric oxide (NO) and total oxidative status (TOS), and marginally reduced oxidative stress index (OSI) compared to the control group. It also significantly improved migraine indices (MI, HDR, MHIS), but showed no significant changes in total antioxidant capacity (TAC), malondialdehyde (MDA), or total thiol content.
population_specificity: 102 women diagnosed with migraine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether postoperative dietary counseling by a registered dietitian would lead to greater weight loss and more positive improvements in dietary intake and eating behavior compared to standard postoperative care after bariatric surgery.
results_summary: Patients receiving dietary counseling achieved greater weight loss (though not statistically significant) and reported significant improvements in eating behaviors important for long-term weight maintenance compared to those receiving standard care.
population_specificity: 84 individuals who underwent bariatric surgery at an academic medical center.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of dietary counseling given to mothers during infancy on children's food consumption, nutritional status, and lipid profile up to 7-8 years old.
results_summary: Dietary counseling reduced energy-dense food intake in early childhood and improved lipid profiles (higher HDL, lower triglycerides) at 7-8 years, though only in girls. Overweight/obesity rates were unaffected.
population_specificity: Mothers of full-term infants (birth weight ≥ 2500 g) in São Leopoldo, Brazil.
effective_dosage: Counseling on breastfeeding and complementary feeding during 10 home visits in the first year.
study_duration: 1 year (intervention), with follow-up assessments up to 7-8 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the long-term effects of repeated low saturated fat dietary counseling on dietary intakes and lipoprotein measures from infancy to adulthood.
results_summary: Dietary counseling significantly reduced saturated fat intake and LDL-C levels in both genders, with additional favorable lipid profile improvements observed in boys. No differences were found in HDL-C or apolipoprotein A-1 between groups.
population_specificity: 540 children in the intervention group and 522 in the control group, studied from 7 months to 19 years of age.
study_duration: From infancy (7 months) to 19 years of age

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of dietary counseling on reducing the intake of energy-dense foods by infants.
results_summary: The study found that dietary counseling significantly reduced the consumption of sugar-dense and lipid-dense foods among infants, with a 40% reduction in lipid-dense foods and a 50% reduction in sugar-dense foods. Exclusive breastfeeding up to 6 months further reduced the risk of consuming these foods by 58% and 67%, respectively.
population_specificity: Low-income mothers and infants in São Leopoldo, Brazil.
effective_dosage: Dietary counseling provided during 10 home visits (frequency not specified).
study_duration: Intervention duration not explicitly stated, but outcomes were measured at 12 to 16 months.

study_goal: To evaluate the impact of maternal dietary counseling on iron deficiency, anemia, and iron deficiency anemia in children aged 12 to 16 months.
results_summary: The intervention had no effect on anemia, iron deficiency, or iron deficiency anemia prevalence. However, it improved exclusive breastfeeding rates, meat consumption, iron bioavailability, and reduced cow's milk and calcium intake in the intervention group.
population_specificity: Children aged 12 to 16 months and their mothers.
effective_dosage: Monthly home visits up to 6 months, then at 8, 10, and 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a low-energy-density diet combined with cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) was more effective than general nutrition counseling plus CBT for weight loss and binge eating remission in obese patients with binge eating disorder (BED).
results_summary: Both treatments showed similar weight loss and binge remission rates, but the low-energy-density diet (CBT+ED) significantly improved dietary outcomes, including reduced energy density and increased fruit and vegetable consumption, compared to general nutrition counseling (CBT+GN). Reductions in energy density were associated with weight loss, supporting the specificity of the treatment effect.
population_specificity: Obese patients with binge eating disorder (BED).

study_goal: To determine the impact of probiotic-supplemented dietary counseling during pregnancy on colostrum adiponectin concentration.
results_summary: Dietary intervention increased colostrum adiponectin concentration significantly compared to the control group. Maternal weight gain correlated inversely with adiponectin levels, and gestational diabetes was associated with lower adiponectin concentrations.
population_specificity: 256 pregnant women randomized into three groups (diet/probiotics, diet/placebo, control/placebo).
effective_dosage: Probiotics used were Lactobacillus rhamnosus GG and Bifidobacterium lactis in combination (specific dosage not mentioned).
study_duration: Dietary counseling and probiotic/placebo administration occurred throughout pregnancy (three trimesters).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of dietary counseling on controlling weight gain and reducing clinical complications in pregnant women.
results_summary: Dietary counseling effectively reduced weekly weight gain in overweight pregnant women (342.2 vs. 420.2; p=0.015) and lowered the prevalence of clinical complications (9.2% vs. 24.85%; p<0.001), including gestational diabetes, preeclampsia, infant low weight, and prematurity.
population_specificity: Pregnant women (10th to 29th week of gestation) served in a public health facility in Porto Alegre, Brazil.
study_duration: From the 10th to 29th week of gestation (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether maternal dietary counseling during pregnancy improves infant essential fatty acid status, particularly focusing on markers of deficiency and sufficiency.
results_summary: The study found that infants whose mothers received dietary counseling had lower levels of a biochemical marker for essential fatty acid deficiency (ETA) and better DHA status markers in cord blood, though no differences were observed at 1 month. The results suggest dietary counseling improves essential fatty acid supply during critical developmental periods.
population_specificity: Pregnant women in their first trimester from families with a history of allergy.
study_duration: From first trimester of pregnancy until delivery

study_goal: To examine the effects of dietary manipulation and pyridoxine medical management for idiopathic hyperoxaluria in patients with nephrolithiasis.
results_summary: Dietary counseling combined with pyridoxine significantly reduced urinary oxalate excretion in 75% of patients, with 39% achieving normal oxalate levels. No peripheral neuropathy was reported.
population_specificity: Patients with idiopathic hyperoxaluria and nephrolithiasis (mean age 50.3 ± 12.8 years).
effective_dosage: Pyridoxine initial dosage 50-100 mg/day, titrated to a maximum of 200 mg/day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the long-term effects of dietary counseling on psychosocial outcomes and health concerns in high-risk subjects with hyperlipidemia.
results_summary: Dietary counseling did not significantly affect anxiety, depression, or life satisfaction after 3 years of intervention, though anxiety increased in both the counseling and control groups. Beneficial health behavior persisted 25 years after initial screening, but dietary counseling showed no additional psychosocial benefits.
population_specificity: High-risk subjects with hyperlipidemia from the Oslo Diet and Antismoking Study.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the adoption, implementation, and fidelity of a dietary and physical activity counseling intervention in community health centers.
results_summary: The study found that 57% of providers and nurses adopted the program, with dietary goals being stage-appropriate in 94% of encounters. However, some behavioral topics like self-efficacy and social support were rarely covered.
population_specificity: Providers (n = 30) and nurses (n = 28) from 9 community health clinics, with participant encounters (N = 266).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether dietary counseling for mothers during the first year of life improves the dietary quality of children aged 3-4 years in a low-income population.
results_summary: The study found that dietary counseling significantly reduced the prevalence of poor diet in the intervention group compared to the control group and increased the number of children achieving higher vegetable and fruit intake scores.
population_specificity: 500 mother-child pairs from a low-income area of São Leopoldo, Brazil.
effective_dosage: 10 home visits providing counseling based on WHO's Ten Steps for Healthy Feeding from Birth to Two Years of Age.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining 40 minutes of physical activity (mainly walking) with dieting was effective in improving or preventing metabolic syndrome in obese individuals.
results_summary: The intervention group showed significant reductions in BMI, waist circumference, and blood pressure by week 12, which were maintained until week 52, while the control group showed no significant changes. The study concluded that gentle exercise combined with dieting is effective in preventing metabolic syndrome, though its effect may be limited.
population_specificity: Obese individuals with waist circumference ≥85 cm (men) or ≥90 cm (women), aged around 62-64 years.
effective_dosage: 40 minutes of physical activity (mainly walking) daily, combined with dieting.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of dietary counseling for homemade food versus commercial MCT-enriched dietary supplements in improving malnutrition in patients with chronic pancreatitis.
results_summary: Both dietary counseling and commercial supplements significantly improved BMI, triceps skinfold thickness, dietary intake, fecal fat, and pain scores over 3 months, with no significant differences between the two interventions.
population_specificity: Undernourished patients with chronic pancreatitis (BMI <18.5 kg/m²).
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary counseling focused on balanced homemade diet; commercial MCT-enriched supplements were used to compensate for calorie deficit).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if gestational weight gain in obese women could be restricted through 10-hour dietary consultations and whether this restriction affected pregnancy-induced changes in glucose metabolism.
results_summary: The intervention group successfully limited energy intake and restricted gestational weight gain to 6.6 kg compared to 13.3 kg in controls, with significant reductions in insulin, leptin, and fasting glucose levels, indicating improved glucose metabolism.
population_specificity: Fifty nondiabetic, nonsmoking, obese Caucasian pregnant women.
study_duration: From 15 weeks to 36 weeks of gestation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term effects of low-saturated-fat, low-cholesterol dietary counseling on fat intake, growth, serum cholesterol levels, and pubertal development in children and adolescents.
results_summary: The study found that dietary counseling significantly reduced saturated fat intake and serum cholesterol levels (total and LDL cholesterol) without affecting growth, BMI, or pubertal development. The intervention was more effective in boys than girls, and puberty itself influenced cholesterol concentrations.
population_specificity: Infants (starting at 7 months), children, and adolescents followed up to 14 years of age.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary counseling focused on low-saturated-fat, low-cholesterol diet).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of dietary counseling, with and without probiotics, on placental fatty acid concentrations in pregnant women.
results_summary: Dietary counseling, both with and without probiotics, increased placental n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids compared to controls. Probiotics combined with dietary counseling further elevated linoleic and dihomo-gamma-linolenic acids compared to dietary counseling alone or controls.
population_specificity: Pregnant women from early pregnancy onwards.
study_duration: From early pregnancy onwards (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether insurance-mandated preoperative dietary counseling (PDC) improved outcomes and postoperative compliance in bariatric surgery patients.
results_summary: The study found that PDC did not improve weight loss outcomes or postsurgical compliance, with the no-PDC group showing statistically greater excess weight loss, lower BMI, and lower body weight at 1-year follow-up. The PDC group also had a higher presurgery dropout rate.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing gastric bypass surgery (GBP) for severe obesity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the long-term effect of dietary counseling on BMI changes in overweight adults compared to usual care.
results_summary: Dietary counseling resulted in a modest maximum net treatment effect of -1.9 BMI units at 12 months, with gradual weight regain during maintenance phases. Factors like calorie recommendations, support meeting frequency, exercise inclusion, and diabetes status influenced weight change.
population_specificity: Overweight adults
study_duration: 3 to 12 months of active programs, with follow-up maintenance phases

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a combined intervention of exercise and dietary counseling (ExD) improves exercise capacity, body composition, and quality of life in patients after orthotopic liver transplantation (OLT).
results_summary: The ExD group showed greater improvements in exercise capacity (VO(2peak)) and self-reported general health compared to usual care (UC). Adherence to the intervention was 37%, with positive trends in VO(2peak) and body composition observed in adherent participants.
population_specificity: Patients who underwent orthotopic liver transplantation (OLT).
effective_dosage: Not specified (individualized counseling and home-based exercise/dietary modification).
study_duration: 12 months (with testing at 2, 6, and 12 months post-OLT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether biannual dietary counseling starting in infancy could reduce markers of insulin resistance, such as HOMA-IR, in healthy 9-year-old children.
results_summary: The study found that dietary counseling significantly reduced total and saturated fat intake and improved insulin sensitivity (lower HOMA-IR) in intervention children compared to controls. The beneficial effect was largely, but not fully, explained by reduced saturated fat intake.
population_specificity: Healthy 7-month-old infants followed until age 9 years.
effective_dosage: Biannual (twice yearly) individualized dietary counseling sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of 3-year dietary counseling, n-3 PUFA supplementation, or both on circulating markers of endothelial activation in elderly men with hyperlipidemia.
results_summary: Dietary counseling significantly reduced concentrations of sICAM-1, sTM, and tPAag, indicating decreased endothelial activation. It also counteracted the increase in tPAag observed in groups not receiving dietary counseling, suggesting a protective effect against atherosclerosis progression.
population_specificity: 563 elderly men with long-standing hyperlipidemia.
effective_dosage: Not specified for dietary counseling; n-3 PUFA supplementation was 2.4 g/d.

study_goal: To investigate the impact of dietary counseling on nutritional, morbidity, and quality of life outcomes in colorectal cancer patients during and 3 months after radiotherapy.
results_summary: Dietary counseling increased energy and protein intake, improved nutritional status, and enhanced quality of life during radiotherapy, with sustained benefits 3 months post-treatment compared to protein supplements or ad libitum intake.
population_specificity: 111 colorectal cancer outpatients referred for radiotherapy.
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary counseling focused on regular foods).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether long-term, individualized dietary counseling focused on reducing saturated fat and cholesterol intake since infancy affected body satisfaction in prepubertal children.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in body satisfaction, desired body size, or body dissatisfaction between the intervention and control groups for both boys and girls. The counseling did not enhance body dissatisfaction or the desire to be thinner in 8-year-old children.
population_specificity: 1062 infants randomized at 7 months, with follow-up at 8 years (217 intervention, 218 control).
study_duration: From 8 months to 8 years of age.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the importance of dietary counseling for older dental patients at risk of malnutrition due to various factors affecting their eating ability.
results_summary: The study found that dietary counseling can help mitigate malnutrition risks in older dental patients by addressing specific oral impairments and providing tailored dietary guidance. It emphasized screening for risk factors, preparing patients for dietary changes, and promoting adequate food choices.
population_specificity: Older dental patients at risk of poor nutrition due to physiologic, oral, psychosocial, functional, or medical factors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate current dietary recommendations for treating moderate malnutrition and assess the effectiveness of dietary counseling in managing it.
results_summary: The study found that dietary recommendations were often vague and ineffective, but properly formulated messages could meet nutritional requirements. Counseling caregivers about family foods showed good rates of weight gain in wasted children.
population_specificity: Moderately malnourished children and their caregivers.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary counseling could effectively increase folate intake and reduce plasma total homocysteine (tHcy) concentrations in free-living individuals.
results_summary: Increasing natural folate intake through dietary counseling led to a 37% rise in serum folate and a reduction in tHcy levels, with further improvements observed during follow-up, suggesting potential vascular disease risk reduction. The dietary group achieved these results without fortification, indicating benefits beyond folate alone.
population_specificity: Free-living individuals (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).
effective_dosage: Extra 350 µg folate derived from food per day.
study_duration: 4-week intervention, with follow-up measurements at 17 weeks post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether nurse counseling could provide additional benefits over usual physician efforts in lowering dietary fat intake in high-risk individuals with a family history of premature coronary heart disease.
results_summary: Nurse counseling led to significantly greater reductions in total fat, saturated fat, and cholesterol intake compared to usual care, with total fat intake decreasing by 14 g in the nurse group versus an increase of 5 g in the usual care group. Assignment to the nurse group also predicted a greater reduction in the percentage of total fat calories.
population_specificity: 117 apparently healthy adult siblings of persons with premature coronary heart disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of dietary counseling alone versus combined dietary counseling and drug therapy on total cholesterol (TC) and triglyceride (TG) levels.
results_summary: Dietary counseling alone (Group 2) and combined with drug therapy (Group 3) significantly reduced TC and TG levels, with greater reductions observed in the combined approach. Drug therapy alone (Group 4) did not significantly lower lipid levels without dietary counseling.
population_specificity: 70 subjects divided into four treatment groups, with varying interventions and follow-up periods.
study_duration: Dietary counseling duration varied (6 months for Group 3, unspecified for Group 2); follow-up ranged from 18 to 36 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if educational and prompting interventions for physicians improved dietary counseling for patients with high cholesterol and led to beneficial dietary changes and cholesterol level reductions.
results_summary: The educational program increased physicians' confidence in dietary counseling, and the prompting intervention doubled counseling frequency and increased patients' willingness to change diets. However, cholesterol levels decreased only marginally with no significant differences among groups at follow-up.
population_specificity: 130 internal medicine residents and 254 adult outpatients with blood cholesterol levels of 240-300 mg/dL.
effective_dosage: Two one-hour educational sessions for physicians; fingerstick blood cholesterol determination prior to patient visits.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of a single dietary counseling session on plasma lipid levels in free-living subjects with hyperlipidemia.
results_summary: Dietary counseling led to significant reductions in plasma cholesterol and LDL-C in hypercholesterolemic subjects and reductions in triglycerides and VLDL-C in hypertriglyceridemic subjects, though LDL-C increased in the latter group. No significant changes were observed in the control groups.
population_specificity: Ambulatory patients with hypercholesterolemia or hypertriglyceridemia recruited from a lipid clinic.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether frequent nutritional counseling improves oral intake, body weight, response rate, survival, and quality of life in cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: Dietary counseling increased energy and protein intake but did not significantly improve body weight, response rate, or survival. Quality of life improved in both groups, with no significant difference between them.
population_specificity: Patients with small-cell lung, ovarian, or breast cancer undergoing cyclic chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if naltrexone, combined with dietary counseling, promoted weight loss in obese male subjects.
results_summary: The study found no advantage for naltrexone over placebo in promoting weight loss when combined with dietary counseling. Naltrexone was associated with hepatotoxicity at the tested dosage.
population_specificity: Obese male subjects

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether practical nutritional intervention and extensive follow-up improved dietary outcomes (food tolerance and regurgitation incidence) after gastroplasty.
results_summary: Patients receiving intensive dietary education and counseling had a more varied food intake, better tolerance of solid foods, and less frequent regurgitation compared to those with less education. Over half of the study group reported no regurgitation at all.
population_specificity: 32 patients who underwent gastroplasty for obesity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the knowledge, attitudes, and practices of internal medicine residents regarding dietary counseling for hypercholesterolemic patients.
results_summary: Only 32% of residents felt prepared to provide effective dietary counseling, and 25% felt successful in helping patients change their diets. Residents had good scientific knowledge but lacked practical dietary knowledge, and 43% had received no training in dietary counseling.
population_specificity: Internal medicine residents actively participating in outpatient continuity clinics in seven residency programs across four southeastern and middle Atlantic states.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of reorganizing diet therapy and dietary counseling education methods on student learning outcomes in a coordinated undergraduate program.
results_summary: The treatment group showed significant improvements in awareness, listening, understanding, perception, and affective sensitivity compared to the control group. The study concluded that the revised curriculum effectively enhanced student learning.
population_specificity: 19 junior students in a coordinated undergraduate program (treatment group) and 11 senior students (comparison group).
study_duration: Last 6 weeks of the semester (laboratory sessions)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary counseling by a dietitian could improve the cardiovascular risk profile and diet quality in patients with established cardiovascular disease (CVD).
results_summary: Dietary counseling slightly improved adherence to a healthy diet but did not significantly improve cardiovascular risk factors (e.g., blood pressure, LDL-C, body weight) or psychological outcomes (depressive symptoms, optimism scores) compared to usual care.
population_specificity: 124 patients with CVD (68.1 ± 9.5 years, 72% men).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the bidirectional relationship between nutrition and immunocompetence, focusing on the effects of dietary patterns and key nutrients on immune function and disease prevention.
results_summary: The review found that targeted nutrient supplementation can restore immune function effectively but cautioned against potential morbidity risks in certain diseases, emphasizing the need for integrated dietary counseling to achieve therapeutic goals safely.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess changes in nutritional status and explore the effectiveness of a four-week nutritional intervention within a multimodal prehabilitation program for preoperative patients.
results_summary: The study found that prehabilitation improved nutritional status, increased fat-free mass and muscle strength, and helped achieve optimal protein intake more effectively than standard care. However, standard care was associated with an increase in fat mass.
population_specificity: Adult patients with colorectal cancer (CRC) undergoing preoperative care.
effective_dosage: Protein intake was set at 1.5 g/kg body weight.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide recommendations for the design and conduct of feeding trials, including dietary counseling, to improve methodological consistency and understanding of diet's role in disease treatment.
results_summary: The abstract discusses the advantages and challenges of dietary counseling and feeding trials but does not present specific results regarding efficacy or safety. It emphasizes the need for methodological rigor in such trials.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of feeding trial design)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a diabetes-specific formula, combined with dietary counseling, could improve blood glucose control, reduce insulin use, and enhance pregnancy outcomes in gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) patients.
results_summary: The intervention group showed significantly lower postprandial blood glucose levels, improved glycemic control, delayed insulin initiation, and reduced insulin therapy duration compared to the control group, though pregnancy outcomes were similar between groups.
population_specificity: 112 GDM patients (56 intervention, 56 control)
effective_dosage: Soy-protein-based, high-monounsaturated-fatty-acid, multi-fiber diabetes-specific formula as milk replacement for breakfast and an extra meal after dinner
study_duration: Followed every two weeks until delivery

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of dietary phosphate restriction on serum phosphate levels and other metabolic parameters in predialysis chronic kidney disease (CKD) patients with hyperphosphataemia.
results_summary: The study found that dietary phosphate restriction, when combined with phosphate binders, did not significantly lower serum phosphate levels but did reduce serum potassium, triglycerides, and fasting blood glucose. No significant changes in nutritional status were observed.
population_specificity: Predialysis CKD patients with hyperphosphataemia (n=72).
effective_dosage: Not specified (nutritional counseling on dietary phosphate restriction).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess changes in nutritional status and body composition in AML/MDS patients receiving dietary counseling and medical nutrition therapy during intensive chemotherapy, and their associations with physical and clinical outcomes.
results_summary: Despite adequate nutritional intake in most patients, body weight and muscle/fat-free mass significantly decreased, while fat mass remained unchanged. Better nutritional status was associated with improved physical functioning, fewer complications, shorter fever duration, and reduced hospital length of stay.
population_specificity: Newly diagnosed AML/MDS patients undergoing intensive remission-induction chemotherapy.
study_duration: From treatment initiation to discharge (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the associations of dietary counseling, age, sex, gut microbiome, and gut metabolite TMAO levels in participants from infancy to early adulthood.
results_summary: The study found that TMAO concentrations increased from childhood to early adulthood but were not affected by dietary counseling. Females showed a direct association between TMAO concentrations and fiber intake, suggesting sex-specific differences in TMAO metabolism.
population_specificity: 592 healthy participants (46% female) from infancy to 26 years of age.
study_duration: Intervention administered from 7 months to 20 years of age.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of dietary counseling as part of a holistic and personalized approach to managing cancer-related anorexia-cachexia syndrome (CACS).
results_summary: Dietary counseling, alongside other nutritional interventions, was found to be a key component in managing CACS, addressing caloric intake, protein requirements, and essential nutrients tailored to individual patient needs. The review highlighted its integration with pharmacological strategies for optimal patient outcomes.
population_specificity: Advanced-stage cancer patients with cancer-related anorexia-cachexia syndrome (CACS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the prevalence, impact, and effectiveness of nutritional interventions, including dietary counseling, for addressing malnutrition in individuals with Sickle Cell Anemia (SCA).
results_summary: Dietary counseling, along with supplementation and personalized nutrition plans, showed promise in improving nutritional status among SCA patients, though challenges like adherence and healthcare access limit effectiveness.
population_specificity: Individuals with Sickle Cell Anemia (SCA) of different age groups and disease severities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether tailored dietary advice improves outcomes in adult patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
results_summary: The study found that various interventions, including dietary counseling as part of interdisciplinary pulmonary rehabilitation, showed positive but inconsistent results. It was unclear whether improvements were due to nutritional interventions specifically or the rehabilitation program as a whole.
population_specificity: Adult patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether tailored nutrition counseling enhances the efficacy of routine treatment for substance use disorders (SUDs) and how changes in nutritional status, including sweet consumption, relate to substance cravings.
results_summary: The study found that SUD treatment was associated with increases in appetite, nutrient intake, and anthropometric measurements, but changes in sweet consumption were not linked to decreased substance cravings.
population_specificity: 38 adult male patients undergoing inpatient SUD treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether medical nutrition therapy (MNT) could prevent hyperkalemia recurrence in patients with stage 3-4 chronic kidney disease (CKD).
results_summary: Over half (56.0%) of patients experienced at least one hyperkalemia recurrence within 6 months after MNT, with an average of 2.6 recurrences. The study concluded that MNT alone was inadequate to prevent hyperkalemia recurrence, suggesting the need for additional treatments like potassium binders.
population_specificity: Patients aged ≥18 years with stage 3-4 CKD and hyperkalemia (serum potassium >5.0 mmol/L) who received MNT in real-world clinical practice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a 12-week combined diet and exercise intervention could improve cardiometabolic health and quality of life in overweight patients with nonmetastatic breast cancer undergoing radiotherapy.
results_summary: The intervention group showed increased physical activity, preserved quality of life, reduced body mass index and visceral fat, and improved dietary adherence, while the control group experienced reduced quality of life and worsened metabolic markers. Both groups saw decreased overall body mass, but dietary adherence improvements were notably better in the intervention group.
population_specificity: Overweight patients with nonmetastatic breast cancer undergoing whole-breast radiotherapy.
effective_dosage: Three personal exercise and dietary counseling sessions, plus three text reminders per week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of individual dietary counseling on nutritional outcomes, morbidity, and quality of life in head and neck cancer patients during and after chemo- and chemoradiotherapy.
results_summary: The review found mixed results, with some studies reporting significant improvements in nutritional status, body composition, and quality of life, while others found no changes. The included studies had low quality, high risk of bias, and heterogeneous outcomes.
population_specificity: Head and neck cancer patients undergoing radiotherapy or radiochemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether using a DASH diet recommendation app improved primary care physicians' knowledge and dietary counseling skills.
results_summary: The app did not significantly increase mean knowledge scores but improved high-knowledge prevalence (12%), self-confidence (21%), and assessment of eating habits (26%). No major barriers were addressed.
population_specificity: 222 Brazilian public primary care physicians.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of a daily clear protein powder shake on fat-free mass loss in the first 12 months after laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (LRYGB) surgery.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results, as the study appears to be ongoing or not yet concluded.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (LRYGB) surgery.
effective_dosage: 200 ml clear protein powder shake containing 20 g of whey protein, taken daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the effectiveness of powdered oral nutritional supplements (ONSs) alongside individualized dietary counseling in managing malnutrition in COPD patients.
results_summary: The study compared routine care (counseling + recommendation to purchase powdered ONSs) with an enhanced intervention (counseling + free provision of powdered ONSs). Outcomes included nutritional intake, weight status, and quality of life, but detailed results were not provided in the abstract.
population_specificity: Malnourished outpatients with COPD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of maternal dietary intake and supplementation of essential fatty acids on gestational period and infant birth weight.
results_summary: The study found a positive association between increased intake of essential fatty acids (from food and supplements) and improved infant birth weight, gestational length, and other growth parameters. Most included studies reported beneficial outcomes, though some participants had comorbidities like diabetes and hypertension.
population_specificity: Full-term pregnant women, including those with comorbidities such as diabetes and hypertension, from both developed and developing countries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the feasibility and impact of carbohydrate-last food order behavioral intervention on glucose tolerance, HbA1c, weight, and nutrient intake in adults with prediabetes over 16 weeks.
results_summary: The carbohydrate-last food order (FO) group showed a decrease in body weight (-3.6 ± 5.7 lbs), suggesting potential benefits of this dietary approach for weight management in prediabetic individuals.
population_specificity: Adults with overweight/obesity and prediabetes (n=45).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether baseline abdominal pain, emotional/behavioral problems, or quality of life predicted adherence to the low-FODMAP diet (LFD) in children with functional gastrointestinal disorders (FGIDs).
results_summary: Greater baseline quality of life was associated with better adherence to the LFD, while baseline emotional/behavioral problems and abdominal pain complaints were not significantly associated with adherence.
population_specificity: 7- to 12-year-old children with FGIDs recruited from pediatric gastrointestinal and primary care settings in Texas.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a combined dietary and physical activity intervention could improve cognition in children and whether changes in diet quality, physical activity, and sedentary behavior were associated with cognitive changes.
results_summary: The intervention had no effect on cognition, but improved diet quality (increased Baltic Sea Diet Score, low-fat milk consumption, decreased red meat and sausages) and increased organized sports and reading were associated with improved cognition. Unsupervised physical activity, computer use, and writing were negatively associated with cognition.
population_specificity: 504 children aged 6-9 years at baseline.
effective_dosage: Six dietary counseling sessions (30-45 min each) and six physical activity counseling sessions (30-45 min each) over 2 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the clinical manifestations, diagnosis, prevention, and management of iron deficiency anemia in children, emphasizing the role of dietary counseling and nutritional education.
results_summary: The study highlights that dietary counseling and nutritional education are critical for preventing iron deficiency anemia, with oral iron therapy being the first-line treatment. Primary prevention through iron supplementation or food fortification is recommended, especially in developing countries.
population_specificity: Children aged nine months to three years and adolescents, particularly in developing countries.
effective_dosage: 3 to 6 mg/kg of elemental iron per day (for treatment, not dietary counseling specifically).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether oral nutritional supplements (ONS) combined with dietary counseling (DC) improved nutrient adequacy, dietary diversity, and food consumption patterns in picky-eating children compared to DC alone.
results_summary: The study found that ONS + DC significantly increased nutrient adequacy and improved dietary diversity and food intake adequacy compared to DC alone, promoting growth in picky-eating children over 90 days.
population_specificity: Picky-eating Indian children aged >24 months to ≤48 months with weight-for-height percentiles between the 5th and 25th (based on WHO Growth Standards).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the prevalence of obesity and variability in management strategies, including dietary counseling, among symptomatic PAD patients.
results_summary: The study found that only 20% of obese PAD patients received weight and/or dietary counseling, with significant variability across centers. No patients received weight loss medications, indicating a gap in obesity management for PAD.
population_specificity: Symptomatic lower extremity peripheral arterial disease (PAD) patients enrolled in the international multicenter PORTRAIT registry (2011-2015).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare psychological outcomes in patients with resistant hypertension receiving a structured diet and exercise intervention (C-LIFE) versus standard education and physician advice (SEPA).
results_summary: The C-LIFE intervention led to greater improvements in psychological functioning compared to SEPA, particularly in measures like the GHQ, PSS, and HADS. Weight loss and improved oxygen uptake were associated with these psychological benefits.
population_specificity: Patients with resistant hypertension (RH).
effective_dosage: Not specified (structured program of dietary counseling, behavioral weight management, and exercise).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of medical nutrition therapy (MNT) provided by dietitians compared to usual care in managing dyslipidemia in adults, focusing on improvements in lipids/lipoproteins and other health outcomes.
results_summary: Multiple MNT visits (3-6) by dietitians significantly improved total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, triglycerides, blood pressure, BMI, and A1c, with cost savings attributed to reduced medication use and improved quality-adjusted life years (QALY).
population_specificity: Adults with dyslipidemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of adjuvant off-label therapy with liraglutide (a GLP-1 analogue) in rare genetic diagnoses causing early-onset obesity and complications.
results_summary: The study reported a case of a nine-year-old boy with severe obesity and NAFLD due to an MC4R mutation who showed deterioration under lifestyle changes and metformin but improved with liraglutide, suggesting GLP-1 analogues may be beneficial in challenging genetic obesity cases.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with rare genetic mutations causing early-onset severe obesity and complications (e.g., MC4R mutation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of intradialytic oral nutritional supplement (ONS) combined with dietary counseling versus dietary counseling alone on nutritional markers in chronic hemodialysis patients with protein energy wasting.
results_summary: The intervention group receiving ONS and dietary counseling showed significant improvements in multiple nutritional markers (serum albumin, prealbumin, BMI, etc.) and reduced inflammation (hs-CRP) compared to the control group receiving only dietary counseling. Both groups showed improvements in some markers, but the combined intervention was more effective.
population_specificity: Chronic hemodialysis patients with protein energy wasting (PEW).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between exercise, serum FGF21 levels, and improvements in NAFLD/NASH, with dietary counseling provided as part of the intervention.
results_summary: The study found that aerobic exercise training significantly improved serum FGF21 levels, which may explain reductions in liver fat and improvements in liver fibrosis biomarkers in NASH patients. Dietary counseling was provided to both groups but its specific effects were not isolated in the analysis.
population_specificity: Patients with nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary counseling was "Mediterranean-informed" but details not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether adding resistance training to aerobic exercise and dietary counseling provided incremental benefits for glycemia, fitness, body composition, and cardiometabolic risk in aerobically active individuals with type 1 diabetes.
results_summary: Dietary counseling was provided to both groups, but the study did not isolate its effects. The primary outcome (HbA1c) showed no significant difference between groups, but resistance training improved muscular strength and reduced waist circumference.
population_specificity: Aerobically active individuals with type 1 diabetes (n = 131).
effective_dosage: Not specified (dietary counseling was provided throughout the study).

study_goal: To evaluate the effect of specialised nutritional interventions, including dietary counseling, on nutritional status, survival, quality of life, and functionality in patients with incurable cancer.
results_summary: Mixed nutritional interventions, which included dietary counseling, showed benefits in 63.6% of studies, improving nutritional status in 60% and quality of life in 50% of the evaluated cases. No significant improvements were observed in survival or functionality.
population_specificity: Patients with incurable cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the feasibility and effectiveness of adding a behavioral weight loss intervention, including dietary counseling, to standard cardiac rehabilitation for overweight/obese adults with coronary heart disease.
results_summary: The study found that the behavioral weight loss intervention (CR + WL) led to significantly greater weight loss (6.4% vs. 1.2%) and improvements in adiposity, eating self-efficacy, and weight management behaviors compared to standard cardiac rehabilitation alone. The intervention was feasible, with high retention and adherence rates.
population_specificity: Adults aged ≥40 years with coronary heart disease and overweight/obesity (64.5 ± 7.9 years, 24% female, 16% Black/Hispanic).
effective_dosage: Not specified (meal replacements and individual dietary counseling were part of the intervention).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of programmed aerobic and strength training, combined with behavioral and dietary counseling, on muscle function, volume, and morphology in patients after bariatric and metabolic surgery (BMS).
results_summary: The study proposed that an exercise plan and dietary counseling would lead to postural stabilization, reduced decline in muscle homotopy, and improved body composition, but specific results regarding dietary counseling alone were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Patients after sleeve gastrectomy (bariatric surgery).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary modifications increasing n-3 EPA and DHA while reducing n-6 LA could alter nociceptive lipid mediators and improve clinical outcomes in persistent post-traumatic headache.
results_summary: The study tested two dietary regimens but did not report specific efficacy results in the abstract. Clinical outcomes, including headache impact and frequency, were measured, but detailed findings were not provided.
population_specificity: Active-duty service members and military healthcare beneficiaries with traumatic brain injury and persistent frequent post-traumatic headache with migraine.
effective_dosage: Not specified (participants received diet arm-specific study oils and foods for 75% of caloric needs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a low-carbohydrate dietary intervention, compared to a usual diet, could improve HbA1c levels in individuals with elevated but untreated HbA1c (prediabetes to diabetes range).
results_summary: The low-carbohydrate diet group showed significantly greater reductions in HbA1c, fasting plasma glucose, and body weight compared to the usual diet group over 6 months. The study suggests this dietary approach may be useful for preventing and treating type 2 diabetes, though effects independent of weight loss could not be evaluated.
population_specificity: Adults aged 40-70 years with untreated HbA1c levels of 6.0% to 6.9% (prediabetes to diabetes range).
effective_dosage: Target <40 net grams of carbohydrates during the first 3 months; <60 net grams for months 3 to 6.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the effectiveness of individualized dietary counseling, protein intake, omega-3 supplementation, and multimodal interventions in treating malnutrition and muscle loss in lung cancer patients.
results_summary: Individualized dietary counseling, increased protein intake, and omega-3 supplementation showed varying benefits for patient outcomes. Multimodal interventions, typically combining nutrition and exercise, had promising but mixed results.
population_specificity: People with lung cancer, particularly those affected by malnutrition or muscle loss.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a multi-component rehabilitation intervention, including dietary counseling, in improving participation rates and long-term physical activity among cardiac patients.
results_summary: The study assessed rehabilitation participation, including dietary counseling, as a primary outcome, but specific results for dietary counseling alone were not detailed in the abstract. Secondary outcomes included health-related quality of life and physical activity levels.
population_specificity: Cardiac patients with ischemic heart disease, persistent atrial fibrillation, heart failure, or post-cardiac valve surgery, residing in Hvidovre Hospital's uptake area, cognitively functional, and physically able to participate in rehabilitation.
study_duration: The study runs from January 2020 to December 2024, but the duration of dietary counseling within the intervention is not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of the SAlBi educa nutrition app in primary healthcare dietary counseling to improve dietary profiles and adherence to the Mediterranean diet.
results_summary: The study was a multi-center randomized control trial involving 104 participants, but the abstract does not provide specific results regarding the effectiveness of the intervention.
population_specificity: 104 participants in a primary healthcare setting (specific demographics not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to clarify the relationship between phase angle (PhA), sarcopenia, and lung cancer outcomes, and evaluate the role of dietary interventions, including dietary counseling, in managing sarcopenia in lung cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found that dietary counseling, as part of multimodal interventions, showed less promising results compared to oral nutritional supplements, particularly those containing n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids, which had positive effects on physical strength and muscle mass when administered early in chemotherapy.
population_specificity: Patients with lung cancer, particularly those at risk of malnutrition and sarcopenia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of individually tailored dietary counseling on protein intake and other nutrients among elderly home care clients with protein-energy malnutrition (PEM) or at risk of PEM.
results_summary: The study found that individualized dietary counseling significantly improved protein intake and other nutrient levels, particularly in those with cognitive decline, while reducing the proportion of participants with inadequate protein intake.
population_specificity: Home care clients aged ≥75 years with PEM or at risk of PEM.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the experiences, adherence, and satisfaction with a combined exercise and dietary intervention in ovarian cancer patients undergoing first-line chemotherapy.
results_summary: Patients adhered well to the intervention, with high satisfaction (median score 8.5/10) and perceived benefits such as improved physical fitness, quality of life, and recovery. Both patients and healthcare professionals found the intervention effective, though further personalization was suggested.
population_specificity: Patients with ovarian cancer receiving first-line chemotherapy.
effective_dosage: Patients attended 33-133% (median 100%) of prescribed dietary counseling sessions.
study_duration: Duration not explicitly stated in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to outline the methodological challenges and guiding principles for conducting high-quality dietary intervention trials, particularly focusing on dietary counseling's role in managing gut-brain interaction disorders.
results_summary: The study highlights the complexities of dietary intervention trials, emphasizing the need for expert collaboration and transparent reporting to improve trial quality and clinical applicability. It notes that dietary counseling trials offer strong clinical relevance despite inherent challenges.
population_specificity: Individuals with disorders of gut-brain interaction (general, not further specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a nutrition-focused quality improvement program (QIP) including dietary counseling and oral nutritional supplements (ONS) in improving nutritional outcomes among older adults at risk of malnutrition.
results_summary: The QIP intervention significantly improved nutritional outcomes, with 52.4% of patients showing improvement in MNA-SF scores, calf circumference, body weight, and BMI. Higher adherence to ONS was associated with the greatest improvements.
population_specificity: Older adults (>60 years) receiving outpatient care after recent hospitalization or for chronic disease management, excluding those with dementia or life expectancy <90 days.
effective_dosage: Not specified (daily ONS intake mentioned, but exact dosage not provided).
study_duration: 60 days of ONS treatment, with follow-up measurements up to 90 days after intervention start.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the nutritional status, food intake, and ability to adhere to dietary counseling in people with symptomatic HTLV-1 infection.
results_summary: A high proportion of participants were overweight or obese, adherence to dietary counseling was low, and its success was limited in improving dietary diversity/nutritional status. Loss to follow-up was a limitation.
population_specificity: 71 participants with symptomatic HTLV-1 infection (60.6% female, mean age 59.2 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of intensive medical nutrition therapy (MNT) combined with metformin in preventing gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) in high-risk Mexican women.
results_summary: The study examined the effectiveness of intensive MNT plus metformin in preventing GDM among high-risk pregnant women, though specific results regarding outcomes were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: High-risk pregnant Mexican women with three or more GDM risk factors (Latino ethnicity, maternal age >35 years, BMI >25 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of combining dietary counseling with exercise on sirtuin levels (SIRT1, SIRT3, SIRT5) in healthy elderly participants.
results_summary: The study compared exercise alone (EX) versus exercise combined with dietary counseling (EXDC). Results suggested that dietary counseling alongside exercise may influence sirtuin levels, but specific outcomes were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: Healthy elderly participants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of long-term aggressive nutritional therapy on clinical outcomes and survival in malnourished patients with alcoholic liver cirrhosis (ALC).
results_summary: Aggressive nutritional therapy improved nutritional status (caloric intake, protein intake, body weight, and mid-upper arm circumference) and ascites resolution but did not significantly improve 12-month survival. Higher calorie and protein intake independently correlated with improved survival.
population_specificity: Malnourished male patients with alcoholic liver cirrhosis (Child A:B:C stages).
effective_dosage: Control group: 35-40 kcal and 1.2 g protein/kg/day; Intervention group: 40-45 kcal and 1.5 g protein/kg/day plus polymeric formula.
study_duration: 3 months of intervention, with follow-up at 3 and 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of dietary counseling, food-based interventions, and dietary supplements on cognitive function in adults with or without cognitive impairment.
results_summary: Dietary patterns, food, and dietary supplements showed reasonable evidence of improving cognitive domains or brain integrity measures, with the Mediterranean diet showing promising results. However, the quality of studies was relatively low, and the role of dietary supplements was mixed, with strong evidence for polyphenols but low evidence for others like PUFAs and vitamin D.
population_specificity: Adults with or without cognitive impairment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the association between maternal periconceptional niacin intake and the risk of congenital anomalies in offspring.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that insufficient maternal niacin intake was significantly associated with an increased risk of congenital anomalies (OR 1.13, 95% CI 1.02-1.24). The association remained consistent in sensitivity analyses, and the overall quality of evidence was high.
population_specificity: Pregnant women (35,743 participants across 14 case-control studies, primarily from the U.S., Netherlands, and South Africa).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of oral nutritional supplements (ONS) combined with dietary counseling (DC) on growth in picky-eating children at risk of malnutrition, compared to DC alone.
results_summary: The study found significant increases in weight-for-height percentile for both ONS + DC interventions compared to DC only, indicating that combining ONS with DC was more effective in promoting growth recovery.
population_specificity: Children aged >24 to ≤48 months, at malnutrition risk (weight-for-height percentile 3rd to 15th), and described as picky eaters by their parents.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a structured lifestyle modification program, including dietary counseling, could effectively lower blood pressure in patients with resistant hypertension.
results_summary: The study found that the C-LIFE program, which included dietary counseling, resulted in a greater reduction in clinic systolic BP (-12.5 mm Hg) compared to standard advice (-7.1 mm Hg), along with improvements in cardiovascular biomarkers.
population_specificity: 140 patients with resistant hypertension (mean age 63 years; 48% female; 59% Black; 31% with diabetes; 21% with chronic kidney disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of dietary counseling combined with medication review (MULTI-NUT-MED intervention) in improving health outcomes for older patients with or at risk of malnutrition admitted to the emergency department.
results_summary: The study assessed changes in medication appropriateness and health-related quality of life but did not explicitly report dietary counseling-specific outcomes in the abstract. The intervention included dietary counseling as part of a broader multidisciplinary approach.
population_specificity: Older patients (≥65 years) admitted to the emergency department, with or at risk of malnutrition (Mini Nutritional Assessment-Short Form score ≤11).
study_duration: Follow-up data collected at 8 and 16 weeks after discharge.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze persistent symptoms, nutritional status, and functional outcomes in COVID-19 survivors at 6 months post-discharge, focusing on the impact of dietary counseling and other interventions.
results_summary: At 6 months post-discharge, 36.0% of patients had persistent malnutrition, 14.3% reported decreased muscle strength, and 14.9% had impaired performance status. Dietary counseling and other interventions appeared to benefit some patients, but obesity and ICU stays were linked to higher risks of functional loss or undernutrition.
population_specificity: COVID-19 survivors (n=136) with persistent malnutrition, decreased muscle strength, or impaired performance status at 30 days post-discharge.

study_goal: To investigate whether a high n-3 plus low n-6 (H3-L6) dietary intervention improves mood stability in individuals with Bipolar Disorder compared to a control diet with usual U.S. levels of n-6 and n-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids.
results_summary: The H3-L6 dietary intervention reduced variability in mood, energy, irritability, and pain compared to the control diet, but no significant differences in mean symptom ratings were detected. The intervention also significantly altered target PUFA levels over time.
population_specificity: Individuals with DSM-IV TR Bipolar Disorder I or II experiencing hypomanic or depressive symptoms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of telehealth-delivered dietary counseling in improving clinical and nutritional parameters in maintenance hemodialysis patients during the COVID-19 pandemic.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in hyperkalemia, hyperphosphatemia, and hypophosphatemia prevalence, as well as decreased intradialytic weight gain percentage (%IDWG) after dietary counseling. The intervention was more effective when contact was made directly with the patient rather than caregivers or nursing homes.
population_specificity: 156 maintenance hemodialysis patients from 15 dialysis units during the COVID-19 pandemic.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze variations in dietary approaches for pediatric eosinophilic esophagitis (ped-EoE) and assess their impact on dietary counseling in clinical practice.
results_summary: The study highlighted inconsistencies in dietary approaches (elemental, empiric elimination, and allergy test-directed elimination diets) and reintroduction phases, which complicate dietary advice. It emphasized the need for standardized protocols to improve clinical outcomes.
population_specificity: Children with pediatric eosinophilic esophagitis (ped-EoE).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and characterize studies examining the effect of nutrition management interventions, including medical nutrition therapy, on nutrition-related outcomes in children and adolescents with type 1 diabetes.
results_summary: The review found that most studies focused on carbohydrate counting or dietary intake patterns, with limited emphasis on tailored dietary counseling. Only four studies specifically used dietary counseling or medical nutrition therapy, highlighting a significant gap in research on tailored interventions for young children with type 1 diabetes.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents with type 1 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the long-term cardiometabolic effects of early-life nutrition interventions, including dietary counseling, based on randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Dietary counseling was associated with lower glucose and cholesterol levels, improved endothelial function, and reduced risk of metabolic syndrome. Earlier initiation of interventions conferred greater benefits, such as improved lipid profiles and marginally lower glucose concentrations.
population_specificity: Participants from 40 cohorts in 21 countries, with interventions starting as early as conception and lasting up to 7 years (except one study extending to 20 years).
study_duration: Varied, with follow-up periods ranging from 3 to 73 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of dietary counseling in preventing and managing protein-energy wasting (PEW) in chronic kidney disease (CKD) patients, particularly those on dialysis, and to assess supplemental nutrition interventions when dietary counseling alone is insufficient.
results_summary: The study found that dietary counseling is key for managing PEW in CKD patients, but if it fails to meet nutritional requirements, oral nutrition supplements or more intensive interventions like enteral tube feeding or parenteral nutrition may be necessary. Partial parenteral nutrition (IPPN and IDPN) was noted as a feasible option for dialysis patients with PEW, though its effectiveness remains debatable.
population_specificity: Individuals with chronic kidney disease (CKD), especially those undergoing maintenance dialysis and experiencing protein-energy wasting (PEW).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the combined effects of supervised exercise, testosterone replacement, and dietary counseling on functional recovery in older women after hip fracture.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding the effects of dietary counseling, as enrollment, interventions, and follow-up are ongoing.
population_specificity: Female hip fracture patients aged ≥65 years, community-dwelling, enrolled within 24 weeks after surgical repair.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a low-glycemic load dietary intervention could improve maternal glucose homeostasis in obese, pregnant women at risk of glucose intolerance.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that the low-glycemic load dietary intervention was studied for its effects on maternal glucose homeostasis, but specific results are not detailed in the provided text.
population_specificity: Obese, pregnant women at higher risk of glucose intolerance.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the efficacy of protein supplementation combined with nutritional counseling in achieving moderate (∼1.0 g·kg) or higher protein intake in healthy adults.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that protein supplementation and nutritional counseling can effectively support protein intake above the RDA, particularly when timed around resistance exercise and nightly, to maximize utilization in healthy adults.
population_specificity: Healthy adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the adherence and effectiveness of nutritional education during rehabilitation of children (6-24 months) with acute malnutrition in a setting without therapeutic/supplementary foods.
results_summary: A change in dietary habits was reported in 50% of children who returned for follow-up, and this change was associated with improved weight gain and weight/height ratio. However, the default rate was high (47%), indicating challenges in adherence.
population_specificity: Children aged 6-24 months with acute malnutrition in Angola.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of dietary counseling interventions on LDL-C levels in individuals with heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HeFH) and evaluate potential biases in study designs.
results_summary: The study found that the apparent lack of effectiveness of dietary interventions in modulating LDL-C levels in HeFH individuals may be due to biases in study designs rather than a true lack of effects. The likelihood of reporting significant LDL-C reductions was associated with the risk of bias in the studies.
population_specificity: Individuals with heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia (HeFH)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the influence of a 20-year dietary/lifestyle intervention on telomere length attrition from childhood to early adulthood.
results_summary: The study examined the effects of a long-term dietary/lifestyle intervention on telomere length, a marker of aging, in participants from childhood to early adulthood. The abstract does not provide specific results but implies the intervention's potential impact on biological aging.
population_specificity: Healthy 7-month-old children followed longitudinally into early adulthood.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the physiology of ketogenesis in pregnancy, the prevalence of elevated maternal ketone levels, and the relationship between maternal ketones and fetal and childhood outcomes.
results_summary: The study found conflicting and inconsistent evidence regarding the association between maternal ketones and poor fetal and childhood outcomes, questioning current dietary advice for women with gestational diabetes mellitus.
population_specificity: Women with gestational diabetes mellitus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how the FADS1 rs174550 genotype interacts with high linoleic acid (LA) and high alpha-linolenic acid (ALA) diets to influence fatty acid composition, inflammation markers, and glucose-insulin homeostasis.
results_summary: The study found that the FADS1 genotype significantly modifies the response to high-PUFA diets, particularly high-LA diets, affecting plasma phospholipid composition and glucose-insulin homeostasis markers. These results suggest personalized dietary counseling based on FADS1 variation could be beneficial.
population_specificity: 130 homozygous men for FADS1 rs174550 SNP (TT and CC genotypes).
effective_dosage: 30-50 mL of sunflower oil (SFO, 62-63% LA) or Camelina sativa oil (CSO, 30-35% ALA) daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of baseline BMI and weight change on clinical outcomes in HER2-positive early breast cancer patients, suggesting dietary counseling as part of survivorship care.
results_summary: Obesity at baseline was associated with worse DDFS and OS, while weight loss ≥5.0% at 2 years negatively impacted DFS, DDFS, and OS. Dietary counseling was recommended to improve outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with HER2-positive early breast cancer (n=8,381).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the feasibility and acceptability of a mobile phone text-message intervention to improve dietary behavior in people undergoing hemodialysis.
results_summary: The intervention was feasible and acceptable, with high recruitment and retention rates, but no significant difference in adherence to dietary recommendations was observed between groups. Secondary analyses suggested reductions in dietary intake of certain nutrients and interdialytic weight gain among intervention participants.
population_specificity: Patients receiving maintenance hemodialysis in two health districts in Sydney, Australia.
effective_dosage: 3 text messages per week for 6 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a 1-year intensive lifestyle intervention (including dietary counseling and supervised exercise) improves health-related quality of life (HRQoL) in individuals with type 2 diabetes compared to standard care.
results_summary: The intensive lifestyle intervention improved the physical component of HRQoL (SF-36 PCS) but not the mental component (SF-36 MCS) after 1 year, with a clinically significant improvement observed in 30% of the intervention group versus 18% in the standard care group.
population_specificity: Individuals with non-insulin-dependent type 2 diabetes (duration ≤10 years), mean age 54.6 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the current literature on dietary strategies or supplements that may impact mood and cognition in individuals with depression and mood disorders.
results_summary: The review found that promoting a healthy diet may improve depressive symptoms and is cost-effective, though the quality of evidence is poor. Dietary interventions showed some benefit for mood disorders but are not yet ready as standalone therapy.
population_specificity: Individuals with depression and mood disorders (general population not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and impact of intensive glycemic control (including dietary counseling) in overweight and obese women with gestational diabetes mellitus.
results_summary: Intensive glycemic control, supported by dietary counseling, resulted in lower glucose values compared to standard control, with minimal hypoglycemia. Medical therapy was more common in the intensive group, suggesting dietary counseling alone may not suffice for all participants.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese women with gestational diabetes mellitus, diagnosed between 12 and 32 weeks' gestation.
effective_dosage: Not specified (standardized dietary counseling, frequency not detailed).
study_duration: Intervention duration not explicitly stated; glucose monitoring occurred at 12-32 weeks and 32-36 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a practical approach for early recognition of weight regain after bariatric surgery, including the role of dietary counseling as a treatment option.
results_summary: The study proposed an algorithm to classify weight regain severity and highlighted dietary counseling as one of the treatment options, emphasizing the importance of multidisciplinary collaboration for timely intervention.
population_specificity: Multiethnic bariatric surgery patients with an 11-year follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether a multi-domain intervention, including dietary counseling, could potentially reverse cognitive frailty in older adults.
